snippet: This autumn, one gallery at the Clark museum will be arranged based on the design of a nonprofessional visitor, and the room will be reinstalled several more times.
abstract: Sterling and Francine Clark Art Institute in Williamstown, Mass, is testing crowd-sourcing on a limited scale with a program called uCurate; will allow one gallery at the museum to be arranged based on the design of a nonprofessional visitor, and the room will be reinstalled several more times based on other proposals from the public.
lead_paragraph: This autumn, one gallery at the Clark museum will be arranged based on the design of a nonprofessional visitor, and the room will be reinstalled several more times.
